Dialogue: So that's cool with you, then?

Dialogue: Whose idea was it?

Speaker: juno

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yes, hello, I need to procure a hasty abortion?... What was that? I'm sorry, I'm on my hamburger phone and it's kind of awkward to talk on. It's really more of a novelty than a functional appliance.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Better? Okay, good. Yeah, as I said, I need an abortion, two... sixteen... Um, it was approximately two months and four days ago that I had the sex. That's a guestimate. Okay, next Saturday? Great.

Dialogue: Juno? Did you happen to barf in my urn? Mac, you know that nice urn by the front door, the one I got up in Stillwater? I found some weird blue shit, I mean stuff, gunk, in there this morning.

Dialogue: I would never barf in your urn, Brenda. Maybe L.B. did it.

Dialogue: The Penny Saver sucks.

Dialogue: Look at this one "Wholesome, spiritually wealthy couple have found true love with each other."  "All that's missing is your bastard."

Dialogue: Well, I'm not ready to be a mom.

Dialogue: Nice to meet you.

Dialogue: I'll get drinks. What would everyone like? I've got Pellegrino, Vitamin Water...

Dialogue: A Maker's Mark, please. Up.

Dialogue: She's joking. Junebug has a wonderful sense of humor, which is just one of her many genetic gifts.

Dialogue: I'm a junior.

Dialogue: Oh, that's marvelous. So you're almost into your second trimester, then?

Dialogue: Yeah, apparently. I'm having it on

Dialogue: The tough part's almost over for you. I mean, my girlfriends always tell me the first couple months are the hardest.

Dialogue: Yeah, but I hardly noticed it. I'm more worried about the part where I have to start wearing jeans with an elastic panel in the front.

Dialogue: Well, you're lucky it's not you.

Dialogue: So, let's discuss how we're gonna do this... thing.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Well, I just have the baby and give it to you, right?

Speaker: gerta
Dialogue: Mark and Vanessa are willing to negotiate an open adoption.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Wait. What does that mean?

Speaker: gerta
Dialogue: It means they'd send annual updates, photos, let Juno know how the baby is doing as he or she grows up. Of course, Juno's legal rights would be terminated...

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Whoah. I don't want to see pictures. I don't need to be notified of anything. Can't we just kick it old school? I could just put the baby in a basket and send it your way. You know, like Moses in the reeds.

Dialogue: Technically, that would be kickin' it Old Testament.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yeah. Yeah! The way people used to do it. Quick and dirty, like ripping off a Band-Aid.

Dialogue: Well, then we agree a traditional closed adoption would be best for all involved, then?

Dialogue: Excuse me?

Dialogue: Well, no... I'm not going to sell the baby. I just want it to grow up with people who are ready to love it and be parents. I'm in high school, dude. I'm ill-equipped.

Dialogue: You're doing an amazing and selfless thing for us.

Dialogue: I want to be a mommy so badly!

Dialogue: Sorry. I was just getting something.

Dialogue: I did steal a squirt of perfume. What do you think? It's Clinique Happy.

Dialogue: Smell those sparkling topnotes!

Dialogue: Viscera?

Dialogue: We'd better get back downstairs ASAP.

Dialogue: Shut up.

Dialogue: It's beautiful. I've always liked Gibson better than Fender.

Dialogue: What do you play?

Dialogue: I rock a Harmony.

Dialogue: Oh.

Dialogue: What? I'm a pawn shop rocker.

Dialogue: Sorry. I swear I'm not a gear snob.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: What is that, Mahogany? What happens if you crack the neck?

Dialogue: Tell me about it. I used to play in a really tight band back when I lived in Chicago, and one night we opened for the Melvins... do you know who the Melvins are?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Well, we were playing with them and I busted this guitar onstage. It cost me $800 and a dime bag just to have it fixed.

Dialogue: When was this, like '96?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: '93. I'm telling you that was the best time for rock and roll.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Nuh-uh, 1977! Punk Volume 1. You weren't there, so you can't understand the magic.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: You weren't even alive!

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: So. What's that thing?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: A Pilates machine?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: What do you make with that?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: You don't make anything. It's for exercising.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: My wife just ordered one of those Tony Little Gazelles off the TV, you know, from the guy with the ponytail?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: That guy just doesn't look right to me.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Will you excuse me?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Oh, sorry honey...

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: You guys are playing music?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Juno just wanted a closer look at Kimber here.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Your guitar is named Kimber?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: That's all right. My axe is named Roosevelt. After Franklin, not Ted. Franklin was the hot one with the polio.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: I think Gerta is waiting for us downstairs with some important stuff for us to go over.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Didn't mean to interrupt the jam sessions.

Speaker: gerta
Dialogue: So, look those over and give me a call at my office if you have any questions.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Juno, we'd really appreciate it if you could keep us updated on any doctor's appointments, ultrasounds, other things of that nature.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Oh. Sure. Of course you'd want to know how your kid is cooking.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: So, then, you really think you're going to go ahead with this?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yeah. For sure. I like you guys.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: How sure? Percentage-wise, would you say you're 80% sure, 90% sure?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I'm going to say I'm 104% sure.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Oh really?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Look, if I could give it to you now, I would. But it probably looks like a Sea Monkey at this point, so I think we should leave it in there for a while until it gets cuter, you know?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: I think that's a great idea.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: That's great, right? Stellar news. Well, you guys drive safe, and we'll hear from you soon, all right?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: All right, take care of yourselves.

Speaker: gerta
Dialogue: All RIGHT!

Speaker: vijay
Dialogue: Hey man.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Oh, hey Vijay.

Speaker: vijay
Dialogue: Did you hear Juno MacGuff is pregnant?

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Yup.

Speaker: vijay
Dialogue: Just like our moms and teachers!

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Yup.

Speaker: vijay
Dialogue: Did you hear it's yours?

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Yup.

Speaker: vijay
Dialogue: What a trip, man.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: I don't really know anything about it.

Speaker: vijay
Dialogue: You should grow a moustache. You're a real man now.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: I can't grow a moustache. It never comes in evenly.

Speaker: vijay
Dialogue: Me neither. But I'm going to stop wearing underpants in order to raise my sperm count. See you.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Hey Juno... A couple of us are going to the cineplex after school to donut that movie with the guy with eighteen kids.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Sorry, Bleek... Going for my ultrasound. Gotta note and everything.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Okay, cool.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I'll try to drop by later.

Speaker: ultrasound tech
Dialogue: That's the feet...

Speaker: all three
Dialogue: Oooh...

Speaker: ultrasound tech
Dialogue: And there's a hand...

Speaker: all three
Dialogue: Check that out... No way...

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: Would you look at that?

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Check out Baby Big-Head. That kid is scary!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Hey, I'm a sacred vessel. All you've got in your belly is Taco Bell!

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Touche.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: It is really weird looking. It's like it's not even real. I can't believe there are saps who actually cry at these things.

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: What? I'm not made of stone.

Speaker: ultrasound tech
Dialogue: Well, there we have it. Would you like to know the sex?

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Aw, please Junebug?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: No way. No, I definitely don't want to know.

Speaker: ultrasound tech
Dialogue: Planning to be surprised when you deliver?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I want Mark and Vanessa to be surprised, and if I know, I won't be able to keep myself from telling them and ruining the whole thing.

Speaker: ultrasound tech
Dialogue: Are Mark and Vanessa your friends at school?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: No, they're the people who are adopting the baby.

Speaker: ultrasound tech
Dialogue: Oh. Well, thank goodness for that.

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: Wait, what's that supposed to mean?

Speaker: ultrasound tech
Dialogue: I just see a lot of teenage mothers come through here. It's obviously a poisonous environment for a baby to be raised in.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: How do you know I'm so poisonous? Like, what if the adoptive parents turn out to be evil molesters?

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Or stage parents!

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: They could be utterly negligent. Maybe they'll do a far shittier job of raising a kid than my dumbass stepdaughter ever would. Have you considered that?

Speaker: ultrasound tech
Dialogue: No... I guess not.

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: What is your job title, exactly?

Speaker: ultrasound tech
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: I said, what-is-your-job-title, Missy?

Speaker: ultrasound tech
Dialogue: I'm an ultrasound technician, ma'am.

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: Well I'm a nail technician, and I think we both ought to stick to what we know.

Speaker: ultrasound tech
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: You think you're special because you get to play Picture Pages up there?

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: My five year-old daughter could do that, and let me tell you, she is not the brightest bulb in the tanning bed. So why don't you go back to night school in Manteno and learn a real trade!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Bren, you're a dick! I love it.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Juno? Wow, I didn't expect to see you here.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I've got something really cool to show you guys. Is Vanessa here?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: No, she's working late tonight. She's trying to accrue some extra time off for when, you know...

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Right. I hear they can be kind of a time-suck.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Come on in. You wanna Ginseng Cooler?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Sure. What is it with you rich people and your herb-infused juices?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I don't know. Something to do with the four-packs...  ...They're not bad.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Why aren't you at work?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I mostly work from home. I'm a composer.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: No shit. Like Johannes Brahms?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: No, more commercial stuff.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Like what?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Commercials.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Have you seen those ads for Titanium Power men's deodorant?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Titanium Power! Get more snatch by the batch!

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I wrote that.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: You're kind of a sellout, aren't you? What would the Melvins say?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: They'd say you came a long way out here not knowing if anyone would be home.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Come on, you're going to want to sit down for this.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Park it, dude.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Behold, good sir! The very first photo of your future child.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: You're kidding!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I think it kind of looks like my friend, Paulie.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Oh, is he bald and amorphous?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: No, he's the dad.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Can you tell if it's a boy or a girl?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: The doctor can tell, but I decided not to know. I want it to be a big surprise.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Well, it can really only go two ways.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: That's what you think. I drink tons of booze so you might get one of those scary neuter-babies that's born without junk.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Junk?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: You know... it's parts...

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I know what junk is.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: We definitely want it to have junk.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Well don't worry about it. My stepmom is forcing me to eat really healthy. She won't even let me stand in front of the microwave or eat red M&Ms. Hope you're ready.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Wait...do you hear that?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: It's only my favorite song. It's Sonic Youth doing "Superstar" by the Carpenters.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I've heard the Carpenters before. Chick drummer and freaky dude. Not unlike the White Stripes.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: You haven't heard the Carpenters like this. Listen.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Don't you remember you told me you loved me, baby...

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Hey, I like this.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: This album is all Carpenters covers by alt-rock bands. It's called If I Were a Carpenter. It is God. I'll rip a copy for you before you leave.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: You don't have to do that.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: It's the least I can do. What did you say your favorite band was?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I didn't. But it's a three-way tie between the Stooges, Patti Smith and the Runaways.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Yeah, I definitely need to make you some CDs. At least while my kid is hanging out in there.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: The Wizard of Gore?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Oh yeah. It's Herschel Gordon Lewis. He's the ultimate master of horror.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Please. Dario Argento is the ultimate master of horror.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Argento's good, but Lewis is completely demented. We're talking buckets of goo. Red corn syrup everywhere. And fake brains up the yin-yang.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Frankly, this looks kind of stupid.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: This is even better than Suspiria. You've got decent taste in slasher movies, Mark.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Here's to dovetailing interests.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: So, have you and Vanessa thought of a name for the baby yet?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Well, sort of. Vanessa likes Madison for a girl.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Madison? Isn't that kind of... I don't know, gay?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: God, pretentious much? I guess everyone should have a mysterious name like Juno, huh?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: My dad went through this phase where he was obsessed with Greek and Roman mythology. He named me after Zeus's wife. I mean, Zeus had other lays, but I'm pretty sure Juno was his only wife. She was supposed to be really beautiful but really mean. Like Diana Ross.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: That suits you.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Uh, thanks.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: You know, not many teenage girls in your situation would actually go through with this.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I weighed my options. But after all this, I'm glad I didn't, you know, get rid of it. I want to have it. For you guys.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: You're something else.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Vanessa. Shit, you better get out of here.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Why? What the big deal?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Nothing. She just hates when I sit around watching movies and 'not contributing.'

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I'll handle this. I'm really good at diffusing mom-type rage.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Wait... aww, crap!

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Mark? Are you home? I want to show you some things I picked up.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Hi Vanessa!

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Juno! God, you startled me. What are you doing here? What's wrong?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Nothing...

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Then what's going on?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I went to the doctor today.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Is the baby okay?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Sure. It's the right size and everything. I even saw its phalanges today! Check this...

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: What...

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: This is the baby. Your baby.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Oh my God...

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Doesn't it look like it's waving? It's kind of like it's saying "Hi, Vanessa. Will you be my mommy?"

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Yeah. Yeah, it kind of does.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Juno was nice enough to bring this by for us.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I came over as soon as I got that cold ultrasound goo off my pelvis. My stepmom verbally abused the ultrasound tech so we were escorted off the premises.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Oh, that's great!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: See? Nothing to worry about.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Hey, what kind of swag did you score?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Yeah. Mall madness, huh?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Oh it's just some stuff I picked up. For, you know, the baby. Babies need a lot of things. I want everything to be just right.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I thought people got all that stuff at baby showers. When my stepmom had my sister I remember she got about a million presents. They were all lame though, so I wasn't jealous.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I doubt anyone's throwing us a shower.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Um, I think people are kind of unsure about the situation because it's not, you know, set in stone.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: What do you mean? You mean...  Do you think I'm going to flake out on you?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: No, no, I don't think that, Juno. It's just that, we went through a situation before where it didn't work out.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Cold feet.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: You should have gone to China. I heard they give away babies like free iPods. They shoot 'em out of those T-shirt guns at sports events.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Right. Well, Juno, your parents must be wondering where you are. You might want to head home.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Naah. I'm already pregnant, so they figure nothing worse could happen to me. I gotta bounce anyway. It was nice seeing you guys again.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Hey, don't forget your bag.

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: Where the hell have you been, Junebug?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I drove to St. Cloud to show Mark and Vanessa the ultrasound. And I wound up staying for a couple of hours.

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: A couple of hours? Why are you going up there in the first place?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: They said they wanted to know about this stuff. They said to keep them updated, so I did!

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: You could have sent it to them. Why would you drive an hour out to East Jesus, Nowhere?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I don't know, I just did. And while we were waiting for Vanessa, Mark and I watched The Wizard of Gore and he burned me some CDs of weird music. He's kind of cool.

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: That was a mistake, Juno. Mark is a married stranger. You overstepped a boundary.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Listen, Bren-duhhh, I think you're the one overstepping boundaries. You're acting like you're the one who has to go through this and get huge and push a baby out of your vag for someone else. Besides, who cares if he's married? I can have friends who are married.

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: It doesn't work that way, kiddo. You don't know squat about the dynamics of marriage.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: You don't know anything about me!

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: I know enough.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: We don't even have a dog!

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: Yeah, because you're allergic to their saliva. I've made a lot of sacrifices for you, Juno. And in a couple years you're going to move out -- and I'm getting Weimaraners.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Wow, dream big!

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: Oh, go fly a kite.

Speaker: bleeker's mom
Dialogue: Hi Juno. What can I do for you?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I borrowed Paulie's physics notes in school today. I'm pretty sure he needs them back, or his grade could plummet to an A minus.

Speaker: bleeker's mom
Dialogue: Fine. Come in.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Hey, don't concentrate so hard, man. I think I smell hair burning.

Speaker: bleeker's mom
Dialogue: Ten minutes.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: What's up?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I just wanted to come over. You know, say hi. I miss hanging out with you on school nights.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: I miss it too.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: So, it looks like you're getting pregnant-er these days.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yeah. Um, I hooked up a whole private adoption thing. These married people in Saint Cloud are going to be the parents.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Really? What are they like?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: The guy is super cool! His name is Mark and he's into old horror movies and he plays guitar. I actually hung out with him today.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Is that normal?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I asked my dad and Bren not to narc us out to your folks, so we should be safe.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Oh. That's a relief.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I'm going to really start looking like a dork soon. Will you still think I'm cute if I'm huge?

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: I always think you're cute. I think you're beautiful.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Jesus, Bleek.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Well, I do.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Hey Junebug, when all this is over we should get the band back together again.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yeah. Sure. Once Tino gets a new drumhead we should be good to go.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: We could get back together too.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Were we together?

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Well, we were once. You know, that time.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: What about Katrina De Voort? You could go out with Katrina De Voort.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: I don't like Katrina.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I totally heard you did.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: I don't. Katrina smells like soup. Her whole house smells of soup.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: What do you think? Custard or Cheesecake?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: They're yellow.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Well, I wanted to pick something gender-neutral for now. Once we get the baby, God willing, we can create a more decisive palette.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Why do people think yellow is gender- neutral? I don't know one man with a yellow bedroom.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: I think I'm leaning toward Custard in this light. I don't know. I should paint a small area...

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Or you could just wait a couple months. It's not like the baby's going to storm in here any second and demand dessert-colored walls.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: What to Expect says that readying the baby's room is an important process for women. It's called "nesting."

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Nesting, huh? Are you planning to build the crib out of twigs and saliva?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: You should read the book. I even flagged the "daddy chapters" for you.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I just think it's too early to paint. That's my opinion.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: And I disagree.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: That wall is going to need something. Maybe we could put our first family picture there.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Hm.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Can you see it?

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Yum. This pretzel tastes like a friggin' donut!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Share the love, Tits!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: She's assaulting me! She's denying me fresh-baked goodness!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Hly shht!

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: That's her. That's Vanessa Loring.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Of the Penny Saver Lorings?

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: No way! She's pretty.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: You sound shocked or something.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: I just thought she'd look really old in real life.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Wah-wah-waaah!

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: She's gonna steal that kid for her collection.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Right, seriously.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Bo-ring!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I want a huge cookie. And like, a lamb kebob. Simultaneously.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: God, Spermy. Must you always feed?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Juno?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Well hi Vanessa! What brings you to the mall today?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Just, you know, shopping with my girlfriends.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: You're gay?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Please excuse Leah. She's mentally challenged.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Oh, okay. So... how are you feeling?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Happy? Oh, you mean like, physically. I'm good. Look, I have a snooze button now!

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: That's great.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Dude, it's moshing all over.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: It's kicking.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Um... Juno, can I -- Can I touch it?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Are you kidding? Everyone at school is always grabbing at my belly. I'm like a legend. They call me the Cautionary Whale.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: I can't feel anything.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: It's not moving for me.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Oh, you should try talking to it. They can apparently hear speech in there, even though it sounds all ten thousands leagues under the sea.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Hi. Hi, baby. It's me. My name is Vanessa. I can't wait to meet you.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Can you hear me sweet angel?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Oh my God -- It moved! I felt it!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Elbow.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Wow! It's magical.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: IF YOU'RE TIRED OF BREAKFAST BUT NOT HUNGRY FOR LUNCH, MICROWAVE YOURSELF A HEALTHY BOWL OF BRUNCH!

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: So, I've been spending a lot of time listening to that weird CD you made me.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Oh really? What's the verdict?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I sort of like it. I mean, it's cute.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Cute?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Well, when you're used to the raw power of Iggy and the Stooges, everything else sounds kind of precious by comparison.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I imagine you have a collection of punk chestnuts to prove your point.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Consider it your musical education.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I'm dying to see what you've got to teach me.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Okay, stop surfing porn and get back to work. Just wanted to say hi.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Go learn something.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: God, you're getting huge. How many months has it been now?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Almost eight. You wouldn't believe how weird I look naked.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: I wish my funbags would get bigger.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Trust me, you don't. I actually have to wear a bra now. And I have to rub this nasty cocoa butter stuff all over myself or my skin could get stretched too far and explode.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Hot!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: God, why is everyone always staring at me?

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Well, you are kind of... convex.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Wow, someone's been actually doing her geometry homework for once!

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: I don't have a choice. Keith's been grading me really hard lately.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Please do not refer to Mr. Conyers as "Keith," okay? My barf reflex is already heightened these days.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Keith's hot.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Eww, he's all beardy!

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Did you hear Bleek is going to prom with Katrina De Voort?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Katrina? Pfft, no way. He doesn't like Katrina. It must be a pity date.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: He asked her. I heard they were going to Benihana, then the prom, then to Vijay's parents' cabin.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Bleeker told me Katrina's whole house reeks of soup!

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Oh, it totally does. I was there for her birthday about four years ago and it was like Lipton Landing. But you know, boys have endured worse things for nookie.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: There's no way in hell they're having sex or even holding hands.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: I wouldn't be so sure about that. He did it with you. He's a man now.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yeah, well, Bleek trusted me. We're best friends.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Are you jealous? I thought you said you didn't care what he did.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I'm not jealous, and I don't care. I just know he doesn't like Katrina and I don't think he should toy with her emotions like that. She seems so nice and all.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: Okay Juno, I'm really convinced.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Prom is for wenises, anyway. Once you're old enough to go, it's not cool anymore.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Are you honestly and truly going to prom with Katrina De Voort?

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Um, hi?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Leah just told me you were going with her.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Yeah, I did ask her if she wanted to go. A bunch of us from the team are going to Benihana, then the prom, then Vijay's parents' cabin.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: We're getting a stretch limo.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Your mom must be really glad you're not taking me.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: You're mad. Why are you mad?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I'm not mad. I'm in a fucking great mood. Despite the fact that I'm trapped in a fat suit I can't take off, despite the fact that everyone is making fun of me behind my back, despite the fact that your little girlfriend gave me the stinkeye in art class yesterday...

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Katrina's not my girlfriend! And I doubt she was actually giving you the stinkeye. She just looks like that all the time.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Whatever. Have fun at the prom with Soupy Sales. I'm sure I can think of something way more cool to do that night. Like I could pumice my feet, or go to Bren's dumb Unitarian church, or get hit by a ten-ton truck full of hot garbage juice. All those things would be exponentially cooler than going to the prom with you.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: You're being really immature.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: That's not how our thing works! I hurl the accusations and you talk me down, remember?

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Not this time. You don't have any reason to be mad at me. You broke my heart. I should be royally ticked at you, man. I should be really cheesed off. I shouldn't want to talk to you anymore.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Why? Because I got bored and had sex with you one day, and then I didn't, like, marry you?

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Like I'd marry you! You would be the meanest wife of all time. And anyway, I know you weren't bored that day because there was a lot of stuff on TV. The Blair Witch Project was on Starz, and you were like, "Oh, I want to watch this, but we should make out instead. La la la."

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Forget it, Bleek. Take Katrina the Douche Packer to the prom. I'm sure you guys will have a really bitchin' time!

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Yeah, well... I still have your underwear.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I still have your virginity!

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Oh my God, SHUT UP!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: What? Are you ashamed that we did it?

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Well at least you don't have to walk around with the evidence under your sweater. I'm a planet!

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Wait, let me take that.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: You shouldn't be carrying that heavy bag. I'll take it.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Oh. It's fine. What's another ten pounds?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Wow. That shirt is working hard.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Is Vanessa here?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Nope. We're safe.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Cool.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Come on, I have something for you.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Oh, Mark! Is this the baby's room? It's beautiful!

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Hilarious. No, I just keep all of my old comics down here, and I want to show you one of them.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Oh God, you're one of those guys...

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: You're gonna like this, I promise.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Here it is.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: "Most Fruitful Yuki"? What is... Oh my god, she's a pregnant superhero!

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Isn't that great? I got it when I was in Japan with my band. She reminds me of you.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Wow, I actually feel like less of a fat dork now.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Most Fruitful Yuki is bad ass, man. You should be proud to be the same condition.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Okay, how about some tunes?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Now this first one is kinda slow. But it's Mott the Hoople so it's still totally rad and hardcore.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I actually know this one.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: You do?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Yeah, this song's older than me, if you can believe that. I danced to it at my senior prom.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: That's almost interesting, Mark. Who did you dance with?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Her name was Cynthia Vogel and she was a good dance partner. Even let me put my hands on her butt.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Oh man, I can just picture you slow dancing like a dork!

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: No, I put my hands on your waist. Then you put your arms around my

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Oh, okay. Like this.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: You've never been to a dance, have you?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Only squares and nerds go to dances.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: What are you?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I feel like there's something between us.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I'm leaving Vanessa.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: It's just not working out, but I'm getting my own place in the city... and I've got it all planned out. It's something I've wanted to do for a long time...

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: No?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: No. No, you definitely cannot do that, Mark. That's a big, fat sack of no!

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: What's the matter?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: This isn't what we agreed on. You guys have to take care of... this! You are the chosen custodians of the big-ass bump!

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: But I thought you'd be cool if...

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I want you guys to adopt the Buglet. I wanted everything to be perfect. Not shitty and broken like everyone else's family. Listen, once I have the baby, Vanessa is going to finally be happy, and everything will be all right. Believe me on this one!

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: A baby is not going to fix everything. Besides, I don't know if I'm ready to be a father.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: But you're old!

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I... How do you think of me, Juno? Why are you here?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I don't know. I just liked being your friend. I sort of liked becoming furniture in your weird life.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: This...  ...this is what my life has become. Stuff in boxes. Stuff underground. Is that so appealing to you?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yeah, I guess... Is this my fault? Is Vanessa mad at you because of me?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: That's not the point. We're just not in love anymore.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yeah, but didn't you love Vanessa when you married her? If you love someone once, you can love them again, I know it. My friend Leah has gone out with the same guy, like, four times. You're just not trying.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I'm such an idiot. I can't believe what an idiot I am.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Please don't get a divorce! God, Mark, just do me a solid and stay with your wife.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: God, you're so young.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Not really. I'm sixteen. I'm old enough to tell when people are acting like total a-holes!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Oh and by the way, I bought another Sonic Youth album and it's the worst thing I've ever heard! It's just noise, man!

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Juno? What's going on?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Mark? Why is Juno crying?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I'm not crying. I'm allergic to fine home furnishings. See you later.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Hold on.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Juno, what's the matter?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: She's hormonal. Right, June? It's just part of the whole process.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: What did you do?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I didn't do anything... I just... I've just been thinking.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Just thinking if this is really the right thing for us.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: What are you referring to?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I've been just wondering if we're, you know, ready.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Of course we're ready. We've taken all the classes. The nursery. The books --

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I know we're prepared. I just don't know if... I'm ready.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Juno, don't worry about this. He just has cold feet. That's how boys are. The books all say the same thing. A woman becomes a mother when she gets pregnant. A man becomes a father when he sees his baby. He's going to get there. He'll get there.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Why don't we let Juno go home and we can discuss this later on, okay?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: It all just happened so fast. We put that ad in the paper. I thought it would take months if, you know, ever and then -- boom -- Two weeks later, she's in our living room.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: She answered our prayers.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Ever since, it's just been like a ticking clock.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: What are you saying?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: It just feels a little like bad timing.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: What would be a good time for you?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I don't know. There's just things I still want to do.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Like what? Be a rock star?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Don't mock me.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: You're trying to do something that's never going to happen. And you know what? Your shirt is stupid. Grow up. If I have to wait for you to become Kurt Cobain, I'm never going to be a mother.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I never said I'd be a great father.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I called Gerta Rauss. She says she can represent both of us. They call it "collaborative divorce." It's apparently all the rage right now. And it's easy because we don't have children.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: No, it's fine. Thanks for making the call, I guess.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: We're actually, finally doing this?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Looks like it, yeah.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Have you found a place to stay?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: Yeah, downtown.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: A hotel?

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: It's a loft.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: Aren't you the cool guy?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: I wanted a baby so bad. So bad.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: I know you did.

Speaker: mark
Dialogue: It looks like a bill from Jiffy-Lube.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: It's for me.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Hi Dad.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Hey, big puffy version of Junebug. Where have you been?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Dealing with stuff way beyond my maturity level. Where is everyone?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Bren took Liberty Bell to her tot ice skating class.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Tot ice skating? Tots can't ice skate. Liberty Bell's still getting the hang of stairs.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: No, but you know Bren. She dreams big.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yeah, she does.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: You look a little morose, honey. What's eating you?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I'm losing my faith in humanity.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Think you can narrow it down for me.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I guess I wonder sometimes if people ever stay together for good.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: You mean like couples?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yeah, like people in love.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Are you having boy trouble? I gotta be honest; I don't much approve of you dating in your condition, 'cause... well, that's kind of messed up.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Dad, no!

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Well, it's kind of skanky. Isn't that what you girls call it? Skanky? Skeevy?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Please stop now.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Tore up from the floor up?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Dad, it's not about that. I just need to know that it's possible for two people to stay happy together forever. Or at least for a few years.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: It's not easy, that's for sure. Now, I may not have the best track record in the world, but I have been with your stepmother for ten years now, and I'm proud to say that we're very happy.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: In my opinion, the best thing you can do is to find a person who loves you for exactly what you are. Good mood, bad mood, ugly, pretty, handsome, what have you, the right person will still think that the sun shines out your ass. That's the kind of person that's worth sticking with.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I sort of already have.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Well, of course. Your old D-A-D! You know I'll always be there to love and support you, no matter what kind of pickle you're in.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Obviously.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I need to go out somewhere for just a little while. I don't have any homework, and I swear I'll be back by ten.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: You were talking about me, right?

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Did you put like a hundred things of Tic Tacs in my mailbox?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Yeah. That was me.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Because they're your fave. And you can never have too much of your favorite one-calorie breath mint.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Well... thanks. I think I'm pretty much set until college on the Tic Tac front.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: You know, I've been thinking. I'm really sorry I was such a huge bitch to you. You didn't deserve that. You never deserve any of the poo I unload on you.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: You know it's okay.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Also, I think I'm in love with you.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: What, you mean as friends?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: No, for real. I think you are the coolest person I've ever met. And you don't even have to try.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: I try really hard, actually...

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: No, you're naturally smart. You always think of the funniest things to do. Remember when you passed me that postcard during Spanish class, and it was addressed like, "Junebug MacGuff, Row 4, Third Seat From the Blackboard"? And it said, "I'm having fun in Barcelona -- wish you were here"? That was hilarious.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: I was just bored. I only think school is awesome like, 80% of the time.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Plus, you're the only person who doesn't stare at my stomach all the fucking time. You actually look at my face. And every time I look at you, the baby starts kicking me super hard.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: It does?

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Wizard!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: I think it's because my heart starts pounding when I see you.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Mine too.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Basically, I'm completely smitten with you, and I don't care if I'm making an ass out of myself right now, because you've seen me make an ass out of myself a million times, and you still want to be my friend.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Well, yeah. You're the best friend I've ever had, even when you're being kind of evil.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: That's all I need from you. That's more than I could ever ask for. You're just golden, dude.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: Can we make out now?

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: leah
Dialogue: You know, you can go into early labor sucking face like that!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Dad!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Either I just pissed my pants or...

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Thundercats are go!

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Ow, ow, fuckity-ow. Bren, when do I get that Spinal Tap thing?

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: It's called a spinal block, and you can't have it yet, honey. The doctor said you're not dilated enough.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: You mean I have to wait for it to get even worse? Why can't they just give it to me now?

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: Well, honey, doctors are sadists who like to play God and watch lesser people scream.

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: Hey, can we give my kid the damn spinal tap already?

Speaker: vijay
Dialogue: His legs are as swift as his seed.

Speaker: announcer
Dialogue: P. Bleeker has just broken a district

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Would you like to meet your son?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: I have a son?

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: You are the adoptive mother?

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: I have a son.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Healthy kid, too. Didn't waste any time getting out.

Speaker: vanessa
Dialogue: How do I look?

Speaker: bren
Dialogue: Like a mom. Scared shitless.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Someday, you'll be back here, honey. On your terms.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Ready?

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: You're a part time lover and a fulltime friend. The monkey on your back is the latest trend. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: Here is the church and here is the steeple. We sure are cute for two ugly people. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: We both have shiny happy fits of rage. You want more fans, I want more stage. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: You are always trying to keep it real. I'm in love with how you feel. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.

Speaker: bleeker
Dialogue: I kiss you on the brain in the shadow of a train. I kiss you all starryeyed, my body's swinging from side to side. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.

Speaker: juno
Dialogue: The pebbles forgive me, the trees forgive me. So why can't you forgive me? I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.
